intro: Erigeron ivifolius, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-gray hue, while the flowers are small and white or pale blue. Erigeron ivifolius is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
